thread.title: Zendaya Criticizes Photoshopped Photos of Herself
thread.title_full: Zendaya Criticizes Photoshopped Photos of Herself

title: Zendaya Criticizes Photoshopped Photos of Herself
text:
Zendaya Criticizes Photoshopped Photos of Herself Posted just a moment ago 
ABC/Rick Rowell (LOS ANGELES) -- Pictures of singer, actress, and former Dancing with the Stars contestant Zendaya released by Modeliste magazine are beautiful, but they're not how her body really looks. 
Her hips were narrowed, thighs shrunk, legs made skinnier. 
Zendaya says when she saw the changes, she was shocked, calling it the kind of thing that makes women self-conscious and creates unrealistic beauty standards. 

A photo posted by Zendaya (@zendaya) on Oct 20, 2015 at 7:49pm PDT 

She released the real pic on Instagram . "Had a new shoot come out today and was shocked when I found my 19 year old hips and torso quite manipulated," she wrote. "These are the things that make women self conscious, that create the unrealistic ideals of beauty that we have. Anyone who knows who I am knows I stand for honest and pure self love." 
Modeliste says it has pulled the issue, which Zendaya acknowledged in her post: "Thank you @modelistemagazine for pulling down the images and fixing this retouch issue."
